title: Busser
description:
**About the Companies**

  

Elsewhere is a multi-room Brooklyn music venue and nightclub built by and for the culture-obsessed, managed by our sister promotions company PopGun Presents – an events collective with deep roots in NYC's underground music community. We are here to empower artists, celebrate the diversity of our city, widen access to visionary and uplifting culture and experience the joy of doing it all together.

  

If you share our passion for music and art without boundaries, and you're looking for the challenge of your career, we want to connect with you - join us and grow with one of the best teams in independent arts, hospitality, events, and culture.

 **Job Description**

  

Elsewhere is looking for an open minded, attentive, and responsible busser for a seasonal position for our rooftop season.

  

This individual will be responsible for:

* Ensuring that the venue (indoors, outdoors, restrooms and floors) are clean and functional at all times
* Cleaning any spills in the venue (sweeping and mopping)
* Removing trash and recycling; replacing the garbage bags throughout the night
* Taking out the garbage during events and at the end of the night
* Pre-bussing, clearing, wiping tabletops, bar counters, green rooms backstage and seating areas
* Clearing bar counters, tables, and surfaces of dirty cups, napkins, beverages, etc.
* Working closely with barback captain throughout the night, ex: restocking the bar supplies, bar set up, retrieving ice for the bars, helping carry beer cases, water, etc.
* Responsible for regularly inspecting all venues for cleanliness (sweeping floors and emptying trash cans)
* Helping sort and organize bar and liquor orders during delivery day (one day per week)
* Supporting the barback team by cleaning up the bar counters at the end of the shift
* Performing basic cleaning & side work tasks as directed by barback captain and managers

 **You’ll be successful in this role if you….**

* Ability to work in a fast-paced, high volume environment
* Must be able to work weekends and late nights (Friday and Saturday) and occasionally holidays
* Ability to lift heavy items (up to 50 pounds)
* Have experience working in high volume settings such as nightclubs or music venues
* Are open minded to a diverse audience (straight, queer, trans, POC, any type of discrimination is unacceptable)

 **Compensation**


$20 per hour

 **Elsewhere’s Values**


These values are real and guide all of our decisions in how we operate and how we treat people. This includes our decisions to hire, reward, and fire. Every single person at Elsewhere will be held to these standards. This is how we build a great team, achieve our goals, and do so enjoyably.

 **INCLUSIVITY**


Elsewhere is a haven for our staff, artists, and audiences to experience the joy of expressing their authentic selves. Everybody has the right to feel welcomed and understood here, in direct defiance of all the ways our society tries to divide us up out there. We crave connectivity and togetherness. We’re curious about the unknown.

 **OPTIMISM**


The chills we get experiencing transcendent music in a crowd remind us that a better world is possible. Elsewhere is a celebration of that feeling - of joy, wonder, and hope. We are here to have fun, and we reject cynicism in all its forms.

 **RESPECT**


Our love for the game comes from a place of deep respect: for the extraordinary history of music and nightlife in NYC, for the working artists out there redefining culture, and for our staff who live and breathe it every night. To do right, we extend that respect to each other and everyone else along the journey.

 **KINDNESS**


Our job means service: to our teammates, artists, customers, community, city, and to the culture. We can’t do this without being kind to ourselves, to each other, to our artists, to our audiences, and to our community. Be understanding, empathetic, go out of your way to help people out, be friendly, generous, considerate. We celebrate individuality, but there is no place for selfishness or ego.

 **INTEGRITY**


We believe strong communities are built on trust, and so everyone must rely on us to be honest, transparent, and consistent. We live our values and stand by them even when it’s hard or inconvenient. We admit our mistakes and work to grow from them.

 **PASSION**


There are much easier ways to earn a living. The renewable resource that keeps our team sustained is an unshakable conviction in some aspect of our mission, whether it’s supporting new artists, helping audiences discover music, building community, or shifting culture.

 **EXCELLENCE**


To accomplish our goals we aim high, and work both hard and smart.

 **CREATIVITY**


The beauty of culture is that it is always evolving, and so should we. We value out-of- the-box thinking, challenging “the way things are,” and imaginative leaps. Like in art, it is better for us to fail trying something new than to not be experimenting in the first place.

title: Front of House Manager
description:
Come join the team at Le Rock!


After years working together at New York mainstays, chefs Hanson and Nasr have established a unique mark on New York City’s restaurant scene creating buzzworthy restaurants that are founded in collaboration, professionalism, and innovation. Their attention to detail and commitment to employee growth has created a company culture that is welcomed and necessary.


We are currently looking for experienced Front of House Managers to join our team. The ideal candidate displays an excitement for food and hospitality. As a critical member of our team, a successful F&B Manager will ensure efficient restaurant operation, as well as maintain high production, productivity, quality and customer service standards, helping to motivate our staff to provide excellent customer service.


We are a value-driven company with an emphasis on employee needs. This is a great opportunity to be a part of an energetic, seasoned and diverse team that is committed to creating an inclusive and dynamic workplace to learn, collaborate and grow.


Le Rock offers a competitive pay and benefits package and is an equal opportunity employer.


ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

* Serve as a representative for Le Rock, upholding high levels of hospitality and service
* Coordinate FOH and BOH restaurant operations
* Deliver superior service and maximize customer satisfaction
* Respond efficiently and accurately to customer complaints
* Train new and existing employees on proper customer service practices
* Implement policies and protocols that will maintain future restaurant operations
* Organize staff schedules and supervise shifts
* Uphold sanitation and safety regulations
* Maintain a good working relationship with others by promoting teamwork and fostering a harmonious work environment
* Perform other duties and responsibilities as required to enable smooth restaurant operations
* Prepare tip reconciliations and employee clockins daily as part of weekly payroll
* Assist new hire, onboarding and employee orientation
* Uphold lines of communication, maintaining a positive working relationship with kitchen leaders and line staff throughout service


KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS

* Independent, self-motivated thinker
* Strong leadership and communications skills
* Leadership and Integrity
* Desire and ability to teach and foster growth
* Problem Solving, Multi-Tasking & Delegation
* 2+ years experience as an F&B Manager in a high-volume restaurant, hotel, or retail environment
* Fine dining experience.
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office- Word, Excel, Outlook etc.
* Familiarity with restaurant management software (Toast)
* Knowledge of Schedulefly.
* Organized and detail oriented.
* Extensive food and beverage (F&B) knowledge, with ability to remember and recall ingredients and dishes to inform customers and wait staff
* Strong leadership, motivational and people skills.
